text: Jasper Newton "Jack" Daniel (September 5, 1850 â€“ October 10, 1911) was an American distiller and the founder of Jack Daniel's Tennessee whiskey.Krass, P., Blood and Whiskey: The Life and Times of Jack Daniel, Wiley, April 29, 2004 (page 7 saying "after he was born in 1849", and page 19 saying "By the time Jack was born in January 1849, ..."). Daniel died from an infectious case of blood poisoning at Lynchburg in 1911. The infection allegedly set up originally in a toe, which Daniel injured in kicking his safe in anger when he could not get it open early one morning at work. He always had trouble remembering the combination. ==References== Category:1850 births Category:1911 deaths Category:Deaths from sepsis Category:People from Lynchburg, Tennessee Category:Businesspeople from Tennessee
title: Jack Daniel
